page.title: 18CHILDRENS GAMES
page.content: get all the nibs in the pog by flicking the marbles with the fore- finger.Each plays in turn,the play passing to the next player if you fail to get the nib in the pog.Different sized marbles rate different values with the oner being the smallest,a twoer being a larger marble,a dobber valued at four and potters,catseyes and peaballs valued at ten. The chief cause of arguement is the 'pusher' when the nib is seen to be pushed rather than flicked.When a player is seen to 'push' he is challenged and the play passes to the next player. There are two basic games, one just a fun game and a more serious game when the person who successfully pogs the last nib collects all the marbles in play.
